name: lazyscripter

procedures: T1027.010::[LazyScripter] has leveraged the BatchEncryption tool to perform advanced batch script obfuscation and encoding techniques.
T1036::[LazyScripter] has used several different security software icons to disguise executables.
T1059.001::[LazyScripter] has used PowerShell scripts to execute malicious code.
T1059.003::[LazyScripter] has used batch files to deploy open-source and multi-stage RATs.
T1059.005::[LazyScripter] has used VBScript to execute malicious code.
T1059.007::[LazyScripter] has used JavaScript in its attacks.
T1071.004::[LazyScripter] has leveraged dynamic DNS providers for C2 communications.
T1102::[LazyScripter] has used GitHub to host its payloads to operate spam campaigns.
T1105::[LazyScripter] had downloaded additional tools to a compromised host.
T1204.001::[LazyScripter] has relied upon users clicking on links to malicious files.
T1204.002::[LazyScripter] has lured users to open malicious email attachments.
T1218.005::[LazyScripter] has used `mshta.exe` to execute [Koadic] stagers.
T1218.011::[LazyScripter] has used `rundll32.exe` to execute [Koadic] stagers.
T1547.001::[LazyScripter] has achieved persistence via writing a PowerShell script to the autorun registry key.
T1566.001::[LazyScripter] has used spam emails weaponized with archive or document files as its initial infection vector.
T1566.002::[LazyScripter] has used spam emails that contain a link that redirects the victim to download a malicious document.
T1583.001::[LazyScripter] has used dynamic DNS providers to create legitimate-looking subdomains for C2.
T1583.006::[LazyScripter] has established GitHub accounts to host its toolsets.
T1588.001::[LazyScripter] has used a variety of open-source remote access Trojans for its operations.
T1608.001::[LazyScripter] has hosted open-source remote access Trojans used in its operations in GitHub.

description: [LazyScripter](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0140) is threat group that has mainly targeted the airlines industry since at least 2018, primarily using open-source toolsets.(Citation: MalwareBytes LazyScripter Feb 2021)
